intro: Schomburgkia undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, wavy-edged leaves. The plant produces fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Schomburgkia undulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in both indoor and outdoor gardens.
